definition: to take delight in talking about sth/to find pleasure in following one's convictions

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)
to be content with poverty and strive for virtue (idiom)

sentences.english: The public have an insatiable appetite for scandal.
sentences.chinese: 公众对丑闻总是喜闻乐道。

sentences.english: Now then you have chosen this poor industry, you should be content with it .
sentences.chinese: 既然选择了这个清贫的行业，就要安贫乐道。

sentences.english: In Rock, a cliff out of a stone, have been talking.
sentences.chinese: 在南岩，一座伸出悬崖的石雕，向来被人们津津乐道。

sentences.english: He hasn't stopped enthusing about his holiday since he returned.
sentences.chinese: 他度假归来，对假日情趣仍津津乐道。

sentences.english: Fortunate are those who are poor in spirit, for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.
sentences.chinese: 安贫乐道的人是有福的，天国是他们的。

sentences.english: Not only I but also she is enjoying the film.
sentences.chinese: 不仅我而且她都在津津乐道地看电影。

sentences.english: Doctors talk about diet as a part of basic good health all the time.
sentences.chinese: 医生们总是在把食谱当作基本的保健方法而津津乐道。

sentences.english: He was envied by many men, cause he had eight wives.
sentences.chinese: 而最为人津津乐道的就是他拥有八位国色天香的娇妻。

sentences.english: The public has an appetite for scandal.
sentences.chinese: 公众对丑事总是喜闻乐道。

sentences.english: Harry potter most people prurient interest of course is super magic scene.
sentences.chinese: 哈利波特中最为人津津乐道的当然是特级的魔法场景。

definition: (affectionate form of address for a male who is not very much younger than oneself) my boy/old pal
to clean the street/to clear the road (i.e. get rid of people for passage of royalty or VIP)
to laugh involuntarily/Taiwan pr. [e4 ran2 shi1 xiao4]
to laugh in spite of oneself/to be unable to help laughing/to break into laughter
You're really quite something!/You're just amazing!
elder brother (often used self-referentially)/(form of address between male friends) old chap/buddy
to deride/to mock/(jocularly) to heckle good-naturedly/to razz
to set off/to take to the road
